format_data:
[{"fieldname": "print_heading_template", "fieldtype": "Custom HTML", "options": "
"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": "EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT"}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (“Agreement”) is entered into on this {{ frappe.utils.today() }}(“Execution Date”) at Chennai:

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
BY AND BETWEEN

AGNIKUL COSMOS PRIVATE LIMITED, a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013 and having its registered office at 910, Syndicate Bank Colony, Anna Nagar West Extension, Chennai 600101 (hereinafter referred to as the “Company”, which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to include its successors and permitted assigns);

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
AND

{{doc.salutation}}.{{doc.applicant_name}} aged about {{doc.applicant_age}} years, daughter/Son of Father Name permanently residing at Employee address with PAN Number (hereinafter referred to as the “Employee”, or other cognate expressions where the context so requires).

Each of the aforesaid shall hereinafter be referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
WHEREAS:

  1. The Company is engaged in the business of research, development and testing of all aspects of affordable launch vehicles including but not limited to propulsion systems (solid, liquid, hybrid, electric, etc.), structural systems, guidance and navigation systems, launch pad services and other launch vehicle sub-systems that facilitate rapid production and manufacturing of both hardware and software for sub-orbital, orbital and deep space vehicles (“Business”).

  2. The Company desires to engage the Employee as the {{doc.designation}} of the Company on the terms and conditions set out in this Agreement. The Employee is desirous of accepting such engagement on the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement.

  3. The Parties now wish to record the terms and conditions governing the employment of the Employee with the Company under this Agreement.

NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, terms and conditions and understandings set forth in this Agreement, the Parties, with the intent to be legally bound hereby, covenant and agree as follows:

Capitalised terms used herein shall have the meaning ascribed to them wherever defined under this Agreement.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "

NOW, THEREFORE, IN CONSIDERATION OF THE FOREGOING AND THE MUTUAL AGREEMENTS CONTAINED HEREIN, THE RECEIPT AND SUFFICIENCY OF WHICH ARE MUTUALLY ACKNOWLEDGED, THE PARTIES, INTENDING TO BE LEGALLY BOUND, HEREBY AGREE AS FOLLOWS:

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
1.APPOINTMENT

  • The appointment of the Employee as the Employee designation is effective from {{doc.offer_date}} (“Effective Date”). The Employee’s employment will continue unless terminated in accordance with Clause 9 (Termination).

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "

  • The Employee represents and warrants that, by entering into this Agreement and performing [his/her] obligations hereunder, [he/she] will not be in breach of any terms or obligations under any subsisting agreement, written or oral, with any third party and is qualified under all applicable laws to enter into this Agreement and act as the Employee designation.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
2. DUTIES AND POWERS

  • As the Employee designation the Employee shall perform such duties and responsibilities as are normally associated with such appointments including the duties set out in Schedule 1, on and from the Effective Date. In the performance of [his/her] duties, the Employee shall report to and be under the direction of Reporting Manager name, designation. The Company may, from time to time change the Supervisor, and the Employee shall then report to and be under the direction of such Supervisor duly appointed and/or replaced by the Company.

  • The Employee shall efficiently perform and discharge [his/her] duties in a timely, professional and diligent manner in accordance with applicable laws and comply with such directions in relation to the Company as may from time to time be notified to [him/her].

  • The Company reserves the right to increase and/or amend the Employee’s duties, which the Employee shall carry out in an efficient, timely, professional and diligent manner.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
3. REMUNERATION

  • For rendering [his/her] services and discharging [his/her] functions, on the terms and conditions set out herein, the Company shall pay the Employee the emoluments (“Emoluments”) set out in Schedule 2.

  • All Emoluments, including the salary and allowances, as well as any bonus paid will be subject to all applicable statutory deductions and taxes, and shall accrue from day to day. The Company will be entitled to deduct withholding tax as required under applicable law. The Company shall also be entitled to deduct from the salary or compensation or any other amounts payable to the Employee under this Agreement, any and all amounts as may be owed by the Employee to the Company, including advances and loans.

  • All Emoluments payable by the Company to the Employee under this Agreement shall constitute full and adequate compensation for all employment and other services rendered by [him/her] to the Company.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
4. EXPENSES

  • As an {{doc.designation}} the Employee shall be entitled to receive from the Company, reimbursement for expenses incurred for or in connection with the business and affairs of the Company in accordance with the policies of the Company. The Employee shall be bound to comply with any policies implemented by the Company from time to time in relation to expense reimbursements by the Company.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
5. OTHER TERMS

  • The Employee shall comply with all the rules, regulations and such other practices, systems, procedures and policies as may be framed, amended, modified or omitted by the Company from time to time and notified to [him/her].

  • The Employee shall from the Effective Date and throughout the term of this Agreement devote [his/her] full time, attention and abilities to the Company. The Employee shall faithfully serve the Company and use [his/her] utmost endeavours to promote the interests thereof.

  • The Employee shall not during the term of [his/her] employment with the Company be engaged, concerned or interested, either directly or indirectly, in any other trade, business occupation, or other vocation (either for remuneration or otherwise) in any manner whatsoever, except with the prior written consent of the Company, which, in its sole discretion, it may withhold or deny. Further, the Employee shall not undertake any activities which are contrary to or inconsistent with [his/her] duties and obligations to the Company or with the Company’s interests.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY AND DATA PROTECTION

  • For the purposes of this Agreement, “Intellectual Property” shall mean all intellectual property rights including all inventions (whether patentable or not, and whether or not patent protection has been applied for or granted), improvements, developments, discoveries, proprietary information, trademarks, trade mark applications, trade names, websites, internet domain names, logos, slogans, know-how, trade secrets, processes, designs (whether or not registrable and whether or not design rights subsist in them), works in which copy-right may subsist (including computer software and preparatory and design materials therefore);

  • The Employee acknowledges that in the course of [his/her] employment and as part of [his/her] duties:

    • he may conceive or make, individually or with others, certain inventions, ideas, discoveries, developments, writings, marks, trademarks, service marks, designs, drawings, improvements and innovations, whether or not patentable or capable of registration in some other way (collectively "Inventions”); and

    • he may develop or produce, individually or with others, certain works in which copyright and/or unregistered design right will subsist in various media, including but not limited to electronic materials (including software or instruction manuals) (collectively “Creative Works”).

  • The Employee must promptly disclose to the Company in writing all Inventions and Creative Works and must not disclose the same to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.

  • The Employee acknowledges that any and all Inventions or Creative Works or Intellectual Property subsisting or which may in the future subsist in them (or any of them) whether or not conceived or made during working hours, including any that relate in any manner to the Business of the Company or to its actual or anticipated activities, result from or are made in the course of the Employee’s employment or involve the use of any equipment, supplies, facilities, Confidential Information, Intellectual Property or time of the Company, shall on creation, subject to the provisions of the Indian Patents Act, 1970, and any other applicable law, vest in and be the exclusive property of the Company in India or in any other part of the world and where the same does not automatically vest in accordance with this Clause, the Employee hereby agrees to unconditionally assign the same to the Company, or, in the case of any future copyright in the same, the Employee hereby assigns such copyright to the Company absolutely.

  • The Employee agrees that, without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing:-

    • any Invention disclosed by the Employee to a third person or described in a patent or registered design application or registered trade mark or service mark application filed by the Employee, (alone or jointly) or on the Employee’s behalf; and

    • any Creative Work disclosed to a third person, published or the subject of an application for registration filed by the Employee (alone or jointly) or on the Employee’s behalf;

      • within the period of 6 (six) months following termination of this Agreement for whatever reason will be presumed to have been invented, created, written, developed, produced, conceived or made by the Employee during the currency of this Agreement, unless proved by the Employee to have been invented, created, written, developed, produced, conceived or made by the Employee after the termination of this Agreement.

  • The Employee hereby irrevocably waives any moral rights which [he/she] may have in the Inventions or the Creative Works which are or have been conferred on [him/her] under the Indian Copyright Act, 1957 as “Author’s Special Rights” and by any other laws of a similar or equivalent nature in any of the countries in the world.

  • The Employee shall immediately upon the request, and at the expense of the Company, execute such specific assignments of any Invention or Creative Works and execute, acknowledge and deliver such other documents and take such further action as the Company may require, at any time during or subsequent to the period of the Employee’s employment, in its discretion, to vest or evidence title in any or all of the Inventions or Creative Works in the Company and to obtain, maintain and defend the Intellectual Property in the Inventions or Creative Works in any and all countries of the world or to otherwise give effect to the provisions of this Agreement.

  • The Employee hereby irrevocably and unconditionally appoints the Company as [his/her] attorney in [his/her] name and on [his/her] behalf to execute and do any such instrument or thing and generally to use [his/her] name for the purposes of giving to the Company or its nominee the full benefit of the provisions of this Clause and acknowledges in favour of any third party that a certificate in writing signed by any Director or the Secretary of the Company that any instrument or act falls within the authority hereby conferred shall be conclusive evidence of that fact.

  • The Employee must not knowingly do, permit or suffer any act or thing or omit to do any act or thing which might jeopardise or prejudice any of the rights conferred on or vested in the Company by virtue of this Clause or any document signed executed and delivered pursuant to this Clause or which might invalidate or prejudice any application made by the Company for a patent, registered design, copyright, trademark, service mark, design right or other similar right in any part of the world.

  • Both during and after the termination of this employment with the Company, the Employee agrees to execute without any compensation all such other deeds and documents and do all such acts as may be reasonably required by the Company for further and better protecting the Company’s rights to all and any property, materials, products, data or documents created by the Employee in the course of [his/her] employment with the Company.

  • The rights and obligations under this Clause 6 shall continue in force after termination of this Agreement and shall be binding on the Employee’s successors, legal heirs and administrators.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
7. CONFIDENTIALITY

  • For the purposes of this Agreement, “Confidential Information” shall mean all information or data made available to the Employee, (whether furnished orally, in writing, electronically or through any other form or medium) including any and all confidential or proprietary information and materials, as well as all Intellectual Property, belonging to the Company or its affiliates, regardless of whether such information or materials are expressly identified as confidential or proprietary, whether or not stored in any medium, all analyses, forecasts, reports, studies, agreements and other documents whether prepared by the Employee or a third party.

  • As Confidential Information will from time to time become known to the Employee, the Company considers and the Employee agrees that the restraints captured in this Clause 7 are necessary for the reasonable protection by the Company of its Business.

  • Both during and after the termination of this Agreement, the Employee agrees to keep and hold in confidence and not use for the benefit of any person or company or entity or to the detriment of the Company, any and all Confidential Information acquired pursuant to this Agreement and/or the employment of the Employee with the Company, unless such information is: (a) publicly available; or (b) otherwise available to such Party without restriction or breach of any confidentiality agreement.

  • In relation to any Confidential Information of the Company which the Employee has obtained, the Employee shall not either during [his/her] employment or at any point after its termination:

    • Disclose to any person such Confidential Information (except such persons authorised by the Company or as otherwise mandatorily required by law);

    • disclose to any person, firm, business or company, any of the trade secrets, processes, equipment, technical data, information relating to research activities, inventions, secret formulae, product lines or development, designs and drawings, technical know-how, discoveries, networks, technical specifications, systems and processes, equipment installed and/or serviced, and other technical information relating to the creation, production or supply of any past, present or future product or service or intellectual property of the Company;

    • disclose to any person, firm, business or company any of the agreements, contracts, services, affairs, activities, lists of suppliers and customers, their requirements, prices and plans of business, alternative business or any other arrangements with customers, marketing plans, sales forecasts; and any information relating to the Business operations of the Company;

    • disclose to any person, firm, business or company, lists of employees and details of remuneration and benefits paid to employees;

    • disclose to any person, firm, business or company, any proposals relating to the acquisition or disposal of a company or business or to any proposed expansion or contraction of activities, sources of capital, banking, financial and investment strategy;

    • use such Confidential Information for [his/her] own purposes or for any purposes other than those of the Company; and/or

    • through any failure to exercise all due care and diligence, cause any unauthorised disclosure of such Confidential Information.

  • The restrictions in this Clause 7 shall cease to apply to information or knowledge which has (and is proved to the satisfaction of the Company) become available to the public generally or otherwise than through a breach by the Employee of [his/her] obligations under this Clause.

  • The Employee shall not at any time during the continuance of [his/her] employment or on termination, issue any statements to the press relating to the Business or the affairs of the Company, except as authorised by the Company.

  • The Employee must use [his/her] best endeavours to prevent the disclosure or use of any Confidential Information to any third party or by any third party and will notify the Company immediately should [he/she] become aware of any such disclosure or use.

  • All books, papers, records, drawings and other documents and papers (including private notes and memoranda prepared by the Employee containing Confidential Information or otherwise relating to the business and affairs of the Company or any customers, clients or suppliers of the Company shall at all times remain the property of the Company and must be returned to it on demand at any time and, in any event, immediately on the termination of the Employee’s employment.

  • Without prejudice to the other rights and remedies that the Company may have, the Employee acknowledges and agrees that damages may not be an adequate remedy for any breach of this Clause and the Company has the right to obtain any injunction, specific performance and other equitable relief as appropriate for any threatened or actual breach of such provision.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
8.RESTRICTIONS AND NON-SOLICITATION

  • The Employee covenants with the Company that [he/she] shall not, for a period of 2 (two) years after the termination of [his/her] employment in accordance with Clause 9 (Termination), without the prior written consent of the Company, either alone or jointly with or on behalf of any person, directly or indirectly, canvass, solicit or approach or cause to be canvassed or solicited or approached, any person who at any time during the period of 2 (two) years prior to the date of termination, is an employee, customer, client, or vendor of the Company or with whom the Employee has had dealings during the course of [his/her] employment.

  • Each of the obligations in this Clause is an entire, separate and independent restriction of the Employee, despite the fact that they may be contained in the same phrase and if any part is found to be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder will remain valid and enforceable.

  • In the event of a breach by the Employee of [his/her] obligation under this Clause 8, the Employee agrees and acknowledges that the Company shall be entitled to obtain prohibitive injunction against [him/her].

  • During employment with the Company, the Employee shall not (whether as an employee, agent, servant, owner, partner, consultant, independent contractor or representative, stockholder or in any other capacity), without prior written consent from the Company: (i) perform any work other than for the Company, on Company equipment, or at the Company offices; (ii) conduct any business with any customer or business partner on behalf of any entity (including herself) other than the Company; (iii) perform any work on behalf of any person (including herself) or entity, other than the Company, that is competitive with any product or service that was or is offered or under development by the Company.

  • The Employee specifically covenants and agrees that during the course of employment with the Company and at all times thereafter, [he/she] shall not make any statement that is professionally or personally disparaging about, or adverse to, the interests of the Company, or any of its affiliates, group companies, or of its officers, directors, shareholders or employees including, but not limited to, any statement that disparages any person, product, service, financing, financial condition, capability or other aspect of the business of the Company or any of its officers, directors, shareholders or employees. The Employee further agrees that during the course of [his/her] employment with the Company and at all times thereafter, [he/she] will not engage in any conduct that is intended to or has the result of inflicting harm upon the professional or personal reputation of the Company or any of its officers, directors, shareholders or employees.

  • While the restrictions are considered by the Parties to be fair and reasonable in the circumstances, it is agreed that if any of them should be judged to be void or ineffective for any reason but would be treated as valid and effective if part of the wording was deleted or the period was reduced in scope, the restriction shall apply with such modification as necessary to make them valid and effective.

  • Without prejudice to the other rights or remedies that the Company or the Employee may have, the Company and the Employee acknowledge and agree that damages may not be an adequate remedy for any breach of this Clause 8 and the remedies of injunction, specific performance and other equitable reliefs are appropriate for any threatened or actual breach of such provision.

  • The Employee covenants with the Company that he shall not, for a period of 3 years after the termination of his employment in accordance with Clause 9 (Termination), without the prior written consent of the Company, either alone or jointly with or on behalf of any person, directly or indirectly, provide or cause to be provided Conflicting Services anywhere. For purposes of this Agreement, “Conflicting Services” shall mean engaging or preparing to engage in any business activity, which directly competes or is preparing to directly compete with any of the Company’s actual or reasonably anticipated business activities.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
9. TERMINATION

  • Subject to Clause 9.2, this Agreement may be terminated in any of the following manner:

    • the Company may terminate this Agreement by serving a written notice of termination on the Employee (without the need to assign any reason therefor), with a notice period of at least 15 (Fifteen) days or terminate this Agreement forthwith, without a notice period by paying all the Emoluments in lieu of such notice, and upon such termination, or the end of the notice period as the case may be, the Employee shall cease to be in employment of the Company; or

    • The Employee may terminate this Agreement (without the need to assign any reason therefor) by serving a written notice of termination on the Company with a notice period of at least 15 (Fifteen) days, provided that upon receipt of such notice from the Employee, the Company shall have the right to waive the said notice period and terminate this Agreement prior to the expiry of the notice period, and upon such termination the Employee shall cease to be in employment of the Company.

  • The Company or any person authorized as such, can dismiss the Employee forthwith from the employment of the Company without prior notice if he:

    • commits any act of fraud, gross misconduct or negligence; and/ or

    • repeats or continues (after written warning) any breach of [his/her] obligations under this Agreement or refuses or neglects to comply with any reasonable and lawful directions of the Supervisor; and/ or

    • commits such misconduct outside work, consumes or deals in any manner with narcotics, inappropriate behavior, consumes excessive alcohol or otherwise falls into such disrepute that [his/her] continued employment will or could likely bring the Company into disrepute or materially prejudice the interests of the Company; and/or

    • is absent from work, except for reasons attributed to illness or as permitted by the Company or in accordance with this Agreement or in accordance with the policies of the Company; and/or

    • is convicted of any civil offence which may have a detrimental economic effect on the Company, or may bear any negative effect on the Company including being detrimental to the Company’s reputation; and/or

    • is charged for any criminal offence involving moral turpitude other than minor traffic offences, or if a sentence for any such criminal offence is actually imposed on [him/her]; and/or

    • commits any act of dishonesty whether relating to the Company or any of its employees; and/or

    • has an order made by a court of competent jurisdiction disqualifying [him/her] from acting as the {{doc.designation}}; and/or

    • is disqualified from acting as the {{doc.designation}} from the Company under applicable laws.

  • The rights of the Company under Clauses 9 and 9.1 are without prejudice to any other rights that it might have at law to terminate the Employee’s employment. Any delay by the Company in exercising its rights to terminate shall not constitute a waiver thereof.

  • Notwithstanding the above, this Agreement shall automatically stand terminated upon:

  • In the event the appointment of the Employee is terminated, the Company shall not be obliged to make any other payments to [him/her] beyond the amount of any remuneration for period of employment prior to such termination. Upon termination of the Employee’s employment, the Company shall be entitled to deduct and/ or set off from any sum owed by the Company to the Employee any amounts which are owed by [him/her] to the Company.

  • The following Clauses shall survive the termination of this Agreement: 1 (Definition and Interpretation), 6 (Intellectual Property and Data Protection), 7 (Confidentiality), 8 (Restrictions and Non-Solicitation), 9 (Termination) and 10 (Miscellaneous).

  • Upon the termination or expiry or cessation of the employment of the Employee with the Company for any reason, the Employee shall immediately deliver to the Company or its authorized representative any property or documents of the Company which may be in [his/her] possession, custody or under [his/her] control, including, laptop, desktop computer, phone,emails, minutes, memoranda, correspondence, notes, records, reports, plans, letter heads, visiting cards or other documents and any copies or reproduction thereof in any medium whatsoever, and all other Confidential Information in whatsoever medium stored.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "
10. MISCELLANEOUS
  • Dispute Resolution

    • In the event of any claim, controversy, dispute or difference between the Parties hereto, arising out of or in connection with or in relation to this Agreement (“Dispute”), such Dispute shall be referred to arbitration by a sole arbitrator, appointed mutually by the Parties, in accordance with the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996. The seat of arbitration shall be Chennai.

  • Governing Law

    • This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with laws of India.

  • Jurisdiction

    • Subject to Clause 10.1, the Parties irrevocably agree that the courts of Chennai will have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any claim, controversy, dispute or difference arising out of or in connection with or in relation to this Agreement, and proceedings in respect of any of the foregoing may be brought in such courts only.

  • Notices

    • Any notice, request, demand, approval, consent or other communication permitted or required to be given under this Agreement shall be effective only if in writing, in the English language, and delivered (i) personally, or (ii) by registered post acknowledgment due (“RPAD”), or (iii) by courier, or (iv) by electronic communication, addressed to the person indicated below (or such other address or to such other person as the concerned Party may subsequently designate for this purpose):

    • Any notice, document or other communication:

      1. given by hand is deemed to be received at commencement of the working day next following delivery to that addressee; or

      2. served by prepaid registered post acknowledgment due or courier, along with sufficient proof of having dispatched the same under RPAD, or with proof of courier or airway bill, shall be deemed served 5 (Five) days after posting; or

      3. is deemed to have been served by e-mail, if proof of delivery of the same is returned by the said e-mail server.

  • Severability

    • If any term or provision of this Agreement shall be held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in whole or in part, the validity, legality, and enforceability of the remaining provisions of this Agreement shall not in any way be affected or impaired thereby.

  • Waiver

    • The failure on the part of either Party to enforce at any time any provision of this Agreement or non-exercise of any of its rights hereunder shall not constitute a waiver thereof nor shall it affect the right of that Party to subsequently enforce that provision or to terminate this Agreement for any subsequent default. All waivers shall be in writing.

  • Entire Agreement

    • This Agreement represents the entire contract between the Parties hereto in relation to the terms and conditions of the Employee’s employment with the Company and cancels and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous contracts, agreements, arrangements and understandings, if any, including any previous or contemporaneous contracts or arrangements in relation to employment of any nature of the Employee with the Company, whether oral or in writing between the Parties hereto on the subject matter hereof.

  • Further Assurances

    • Each of the Parties to this Agreement shall from time to time execute and deliver all such further documents and do all acts and things as any other Party may reasonably require to effectively implement the full intent and meaning of this Agreement and/or to complete the transactions contemplated hereunder.

  • Cumulative Rights

    • All rights granted to either of the Parties shall be cumulative and no exercise by either of the Parties of any right under this Agreement shall restrict or prejudice the exercise of any other right granted by this Agreement or otherwise available to it.

  • Amendments

    • Unless this Agreement provides for the Company to stipulate any provision or other matter in relation to the employment herein contained, no amendment of any provision of this Agreement, nor consent to any departure by any of the Parties therefrom, shall in any event be effective unless the same shall be in writing and signed by the Parties hereto and then such waiver or consent shall be effective only in the specific instance and for the specific purpose for which it is given.

  • Counterparts

    • This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts and by the different Parties on separate counterparts, each of which when so executed and delivered shall be an original, but all of which shall together constitute one and the same instrument.

"}, {"fieldtype": "Section Break", "label": ""}, {"fieldtype": "Column Break"}, {"fieldname": "_custom_html", "print_hide": 0, "label": "Custom HTML", "fieldtype": "HTML", "options": "

name: Job offer1
